message_1:
A temperature sensor in a room gives a reading of 22°C. Using fuzzy logic, determine the linguistic values of the temperature in the following sets: 

1) Cold: 0-10°C
2) Cool: 5-20°C
3) Warm: 15-30°C
4) Hot: 25-40°C

Assign degrees of membership (between 0 and 1) to each set based on the sensor’s reading.
message_2:
To determine the linguistic values of the temperature using fuzzy logic, we will calculate the degree of membership for each set based on the sensor's reading of 22°C.

1) Cold: 0-10°C
Since 22°C is outside the range of the Cold set, the degree of membership is 0.

2) Cool: 5-20°C
22°C is outside the range of the Cool set, so the degree of membership is 0.

3) Warm: 15-30°C
22°C is within the range of the Warm set. To calculate the degree of membership, we can use the following formula:

Degree of membership = (Temperature - Lower limit) / (Upper limit - Lower limit)

Degree of membership (Warm) = (22 - 15) / (30 - 15) = 7 / 15 ≈ 0.467

4) Hot: 25-40°C
22°C is below the lower limit of the Hot set. However, since it's close to the lower limit, we can calculate the degree of membership using the following formula:

Degree of membership = (Upper limit - Temperature) / (Upper limit - Lower limit)

Degree of membership (Hot) = (25 - 22) / (25 - 15) = 3 / 10 = 0.3

So, the degrees of membership for each set are:

1) Cold: 0
2) Cool: 0
3) Warm: 0.467
4) Hot: 0.3
